parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post mentions several candidates from different parties (SENS, S.O.S. România, DREPT, PNCR, PER, UDMR, ADN) and quotes their statements regarding women's and LGBTQ+ rights.  While it doesn't explicitly endorse or oppose any candidate, it clearly identifies them by name and party affiliation, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for wide public reach. The content is not a private communication but aims to disseminate information to a broad audience.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True. While the post doesn't explicitly urge voters to vote for or against specific candidates, presenting candidates' views on sensitive social issues like women's and LGBTQ+ rights during the election period could indirectly influence voters' choices. The selection of quotes and the parties represented might be interpreted as having an electoral objective, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c. However, it could also be argued that the objective is to inform the public about the candidates' stances on these issues, which is not inherently illegal.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post presents itself as a compilation of quotes from various candidates, resembling a form of citizen journalism. However, the selection of quotes and the absence of counterpoints or diverse perspectives could be seen as biased, potentially exceeding the limits of objective journalism as defined in Article 36 (7) - d.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post doesn't express personal opinions but rather presents candidates' statements.  The selection and presentation of these statements, however, could be interpreted as a form of advocacy, rather than neutral reporting.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1125773355569863</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post presents a compilation of quotes from various candidates regarding their stances on women's and LGBTQ+ rights. While it doesn't explicitly endorse or oppose any candidate, the selection of quotes and the parties represented could be interpreted as having an electoral objective.  The post fulfills criteria a and c of Article 36 (7) and potentially d, making it a borderline case.  The argument against it being electoral propaganda is that it aims to inform the public about candidates' views on important social issues. The argument for it being electoral propaganda is that the selection of quotes and the context could subtly influence voters' choices.  In dubio pro reo, we lean towards the latter interpretation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Florina Presadă</name><impact>NEUTRAL</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Diana Șoșoacă</name><impact>NEUTRAL</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Cosette Chichirău</name><impact>NEUTRAL</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Cristian Terheș</name><impact>NEUTRAL</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Szabo Odon</name><impact>NEUTRAL</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Alexandra Păcuraru</name><impact>NEUTRAL</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>MozaiQ</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
MozaiQ, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 1125773355569863) care, deși nu îndeamnă explicit la votul pentru sau împotriva unor candidați, prezintă declarații selective ale acestora pe teme sensibile (drepturile femeilor și LGBTQ+), având potențialul de a influența alegătorii.  Selecția declarațiilor și contextul în care sunt prezentate, fără contrapuncte sau perspective diverse, depășesc limitele jurnalismului obiectiv, conform articolului 36 (7) din LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. Efectul electoral este indirect, dar potențial semnificativ, prin influențarea percepției alegătorilor asupra candidaților.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
